page.title: 01THE SEVERN ESTUARY
page.content: THE WENTLOOG LEVELS. The region bordering the north side of the estuary consists of two well defined areas.Behind the sea-wall some of the land is below high water mark but the north-western sector,about one third of the area,rises gently above the 8m.contour and contains the main concentration of housing. An extensive system of ditches and channels,known locally as reens,drains the low ground providing an area almost permanently free of flooding for agricultural purposes.Twelve farmers are located within the block grazing. Centrally situated is the village of Marshfield with a population of 1,277 and in the south-west corner on the coast Peterstone Wentloog with 213.
